definitions.definition: (of several people or things) come together from different directions so as eventually to meet.
examples: convoys from America and the UK traversed thousands of miles to converge in the Atlantic

definitions.definition: come from different directions and meet at (a place).
examples: half a million sports fans will converge on the capital

definitions.definition: (of a number of things) gradually change so as to become similar or develop something in common.
examples: two cultures converged as the French settled Vermont

definitions.definition: (of lines) tend to meet at a point.
examples: a pair of lines of longitude are parallel at the equator but converge toward the poles
synonyms: merge "the tracks converge at Union Station"

definitions.definition: (of a series) approximate in the sum of its terms toward a definite limit.
examples: the powers of e therefore converge very slowly
